Pre-Game Insights: Northern Ireland began their latest Nations League campaign by beating Luxembourg 2-0 in Belfast.
Michael O'Neill's men then lost 1-0 in Bulgaria three days later.
Northern Ireland's last outing in the Nations League resulted in a meagre tally of five points from six matches.
Belarus saw off Luxembourg by virtue of a second-half strike from substitute Valeri Gromyko.
Michael O'Neill will be without injured goalkeeper Bailey Peacock-Farrell for both Nations League games.
Dan Ballard is sidelined and Manchester United's Jonny Evans recently retired from international football.
Jamie Reid returns after a blood clot caused the Stevenage striker to miss September's matches.
Josh Magennis is the most experienced of the four forwards selected, with 11 goals from 79 caps to date.
Uncapped ADO Den Haag striker Lee Bonis netted a hat-trick for his club last week.
Belarus champions Dinamo Minsk are representing their nation in the Conference League this season.
Dmitri Antilevski and Yevgeni Shikavka are set to keep their places in the White Wings' front line.
Veteran centre-back Alyaksandr Martynovich has 77 international caps to his name and will most likely feature in the middle of a three-man defence.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held behind closed doors at ZTE Arena in Zalaegerszeg, Hungary, due to UEFA restrictions.
